benchmark_details.name: AGENT SAFE
benchmark_details.overview: AGENT SAFE is the first comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the safety of embodied VLM agents under hazardous instructions, featuring a risk-aware instruction dataset and evaluating agents across perception, planning, and action stages using 45 adversarial scenarios and 1,350 hazardous tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of AGENT SAFE is to systematically evaluate the safety vulnerabilities of embodied VLM agents against hazardous instructions in simulated environments.

data.source: The dataset is constructed from real-world inspired instructions categorized into benign and risk-aware instructions.
data.annotation: Hybrid data generation protocol combining manual and model-assisted generation.

methodology.calculation: The metrics are evaluated through a three-stage evaluation process: perception, planning, and action.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in metrics like Planning Success Rate and Execution Success Rate indicate better performance, while lower values in Planning Rejection Rate indicate a reluctance to accept harmful commands.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated through extensive experiments to reveal vulnerabilities in safety mechanisms.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset and evaluation sandbox will be released under a research-only license with explicit terms prohibiting misuse.
